text: Catalan solids are a concept from geometry: For each Archimedean solid there is a Catalan solid that is its dual polyhedron. In total, there are thirteen Catalan solids (as there are thirteen Archimedean solids). They are named after the Belgian mathematician Eug√®ne Charles Catalan of the 19th centurty. Each Catalan solid is a convex polyhedron. Like with Archimedean solids, each surface is made of the same shape. Category:Polyhedra
title: Catalan solid
